bibl.title: A Greek Papyrus and Two Mummy Labels from Durham, U.K.
bibl.note: a. The Papyrus. Inv. 1978.8. Short notification by a priest Ammonios to two 'sons', Aphous and Horion, about money owed after a transaction concerning the price of hemp. Ptel, Oxy. Nome, 5th century A.D. - b. The Mummy Labels: 1. Inv. Wel(come collection) 136. Hermonthis, 2nd or 3rd century A.D.; - 2. Inv. N 2004 (formerly: collection Duke of Northumberland). One side with a Greek text, the other with a text in demotic. Late Ptolemaic/Early Roman.
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Durham Oriental Mus. Inv. 1978.8 143.12 / 4 T. Durham Oriental Mus. Inv. N 2004 143.4 T. Durham Oriental Mus. Inv. Wel. 136
WORP K.A., A Greek Papyrus and Two Mummy Labels from Durham, U.K.

a. The Papyrus. Inv. 1978.8. Short notification by a priest Ammonios to two 'sons', Aphous and Horion, about money owed after a transaction concerning the price of hemp. Ptel, Oxy. Nome, 5th century A.D. - b. The Mummy Labels: 1. Inv. Wel(come collection) 136. Hermonthis, 2nd or 3rd century A.D.; - 2. Inv. N 2004 (formerly: collection Duke of Northumberland). One side with a Greek text, the other with a text in demotic. Late Ptolemaic/Early Roman.
